short_summary: Defence Construction Canada – Request for Qualifications (RFQ) for a National Unexploded Explosive Ordnance (UXO) Source List

full_summary:
### Government Tender Announcement: Unexploded Explosive Ordnances (UXO) Services Source List

#### Solicitation Number: MECSL23-79926
#### Publication Date: August 24, 2023
#### Closing Date: September 14, 2023 (2:00 PM EST)
#### Solicitation by: Defence Construction Canada / Construction de Défense Canada

**Objective and Scope:**

Defence Construction Canada (DCC) is seeking Service Providers for a National Unexploded Explosive Ordnances (UXO) Source List (UXO SL) to provide services to support the Department of National Defence (DND) at various locations across Canada.

**Procurement Method:**

This solicitation employs a competitive, traditional Request for Qualifications (RFQ) method.

**Essential Information:**

* SL period: 1 year from July 27, 2023 (MECSL23 establishment date)
* Estimated maximum value: $15,000,000.00
* Commissions: $100,000.00 - $500,000.00 (no maximum limit)
* Services: "as and when required" UXO services supporting DND requirements

**Bidding Process:**

Interested companies are encouraged to submit abbreviated proposals through the MERX Electronic Bidding System before the closing date and time. Bids should be submitted in accordance with the guidelines outlined in the solicitation document.

**Additional Information:**

* Proposal evaluation will be conducted based on established criteria outlined in the solicitation document
* Companies interested in participating in the UXO SL are invited to submit their proposals
* Bidding and documents are available on the MERX website (http://www.merx.com)

**Contract Award Information:**

Proponents can expect to receive contract award results from the DCC website at Contract Activity - Defence Construction Canada (cdc-dcc.gc.ca).

**Contact Information:**

For more information or questions, please contact Mark Smith at mark.smith@dcc-cdc.gc.ca or 613-859-0549.

**Trade Agreements:**

This procurement is subject to the following trade agreements:
* Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)
* World Trade Organization Agreement on Government Procurement (WTO GPA)
* Canada-European Union Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA)

The rewritten version has the same number of words (approximately 380 words), but is formatted in a more professional and clean manner. The essential information is still there, with minor adjustments to make it even
